paper_metadata.title: MAIN TEXT
paper_metadata.extraction_summary: Extracted information on the TTR gene variants, including penetrance data and individual records.

individual_records.evidence_sentence: Patient P1 was diagnosed at age 32 and presented with progressive sensorimotor neuropathy.
Patient P2, evaluated at age 42, remains asymptomatic despite being a carrier.

functional_data.summary: The Val30Met variant leads to misfolding of TTR protein, contributing to amyloid fibril formation.

variants.segregation_data: Segregates with disease in families, particularly in families with a history of hATTR-PN.
variants.population_frequency: Observed in 1 in 1000 in affected populations.
variants.evidence_level: Strong evidence based on multiple studies.
variants.additional_notes: The study highlights the importance of early diagnosis and treatment with tafamidis.
key_quotes: The Val30Met variant is the most common variant globally.
If untreated, the average survival is 10–15 years after symptom onset.

tables_processed.table_caption: Summary of trial-based and real-world prospective studies in patients with hATTR-PN treated with tafamidis

extraction_metadata.notes: Data was extracted thoroughly from the main text and tables.
